description.narrative: As the "Marriage is not Child's Play" project comes to an end on December 31, 2020, and in anticipation of a possible second phase,the More than Brides alliance has been working on a concept note based on the lessons learned from the MNCP program. The concept note, entitled "My Choice, My Voice" (MCMV), was submitted to the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs in response to its call for SRHR 2021-2025 strategic partnerships. Although the quality of the concept note was good, it was unfortunately rejected for technical/administrative reasons. Building on lessons learned from the "Marriage is not Child's Play" project, the "My Choice, My Voice" project moves away from preventing child marriage to focus on expanding girls' options and choices to increase their empowerment. We view child marriage as a symptom of social and gender norms that limit girls' options and choices in life and prevent them from using their voices. My Choice, My Voice therefore focuses on girls' empowerment, autonomy, and collective voice: addressing the root causes rather than the symptom.We focus on the power holders closest to the girls who-we have learned-hold the most power over girls' life choices. These include close family members, fathers, brothers, uncles, grandparents, but also other community members, teachers and religious leaders. In addition, there is an even greater emphasis on enabling change within the girls themselves, to find their power and inner strength to become agents of change in their own lives and futures. We also aim to strengthen civil actors in their effortsto advocate for gender equality and sexual reproductive health and rights and to ensure that they welcome and support the voices ofyouth. The MNCP project provides a solid foundation for this work asyouth groups in Niger have been created and have developed their capacities and common agendas. Recently, some have officially registered as associations and are expressing their aspirations. Communities and local civil society actors are beginning to engage meaningfully and listen to the girls.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib was founded in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Oxfam Novib is member of the Oxfam International confederation. Working together in the confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education for all, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam Novib's main office is based in The Netherlands, it supports the work of a network of local offices, the implementation of global projects, fundraising, campaigning and advocacy. Oxfam Novib’s the Hague office contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to basic social services
